item.title: Curriculum Vitae
item.description: Below is a copy of my Curriculum Vitae last updated on 26/09/2019. You can also reach out to me here. hey hey

item.title: Talks
item.description: This is a listing of the talks by me given in conferences.

item.title: About Me
item.description: I am Nabarun Pal, a final year undergraduate student at Indian Institute of Technology Roorkee. I am an active contributor to various open source projects, prominently Open Source Functions as a Service framework called firefly. I am passionate about software development. I can also talk about Internet of Things, Electronics, Robotics with equal spirit. My journey with the field of software and robotics started in my schooling days. I represented the university in various competitions like Mercari Hackathon, Microsoft code.

item.title: About
item.description: Erlich administers the Hacker Hostel, a tech incubator where Richard, Big Head, Dinesh, and Gilfoyle live and work in exchange for 10 percent of their potential businesses. Erlich clings to his glory days, when he sold aviation start-up Aviato, a move that, at least in his mind, qualifies him to be a svengali lording over other tech nerds. He still drives a car emblazoned with multiple Aviato logos and smokes copious amounts of weed.
